1.definition: a deed that grants only whatever title or interest the grantor had to the property without any warranty as to the title

2.definition: in this entry comparein this entry

deed of trust.definition: an instrument securing a debt in which a debtor conveys the legal ownership of real property to a trustee to be held in trust for the benefit of the creditor or to be sold upon the debtor's default to pay the debta mortgage with a power of sale called also

masÂ·ter deed.definition: a deed that submits the land described therein to the provisions of a state's law regarding condominiums and sets out various information (as about the units, common areas, bylaws, and rights of the owners) as required under state law compareat

sheriff's deed.definition: a deed given to a buyer of property purchased at a sheriff's sale

special warranty deed.definition: a deed in which the property transferred is warranted to be free of all liens or encumbrances made by, through, or under the grantor

tax deed.definition: a deed evidencing the transfer of title acquired by the grantee as purchaser of property at a tax sale compare

unit deed.definition: a deed conveying a condominium unit

warranty deed.definition: a deed warranting that the grantor has a good title free and clear of all encumbrances and will defend the grantee against all claims comparein this entryvtto convey by deed
